item.title: 假期消费强劲，Visa 利润大增
item.description: 周四，Visa 公布第一季度利润增长，原因是这家全球最大的支付处理商的客户在节假日期间在从旅游到外出就餐等各个方面大肆挥霍。【原文：Visa reported a higher first-quarter profit on Thursday as the world's largest payment processor's customers splurged on everything from travel to dining out during the holiday season.】

item.title: 英特尔营收预期令人失望，投资者等待新任首席执行官上任
item.description: 英特尔公司周四公布的第一季度营收预期不及分析师预期，该芯片制造商正努力应对传统数据中心芯片需求不振和关键个人电脑市场份额下降的问题。【原文：Intel's first-quarter revenue forecast on Thursday missed analyst estimates, as the chipmaker grapples with tepid demand for traditional data center chips and declining share in the key personal computer market.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国将对墨西哥和加拿大商品征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，美国将对从墨西哥和加拿大进口的商品征收25%的关税，重申了他对这两个美国主要贸易伙伴国的警告。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said the United States will put a 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada, repeating his warning to the two countries which are top U.S. trade partners.】

item.title: 波音公司撤换 "星际客机 "飞船部门主管
item.description: 波音公司发言人周四告诉路透社，领导波音公司 "星际客机 "航天器部门的副总裁马克-纳皮（Mark Nappi）已经离开了这个陷入困境的项目，接替他的是该公司国际空间站项目经理约翰-穆赫兰（John Mulholland）。【原文：The vice president leading Boeing's Starliner spacecraft unit, Mark Nappi, has left the troubled program and was replaced by the company's International Space Station program manager, John Mulholland, a Boeing spokesperson told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 立法者敦促特朗普考虑对中国深鉴科技使用的英伟达芯片实施新的限制措施
item.description: 两名美国国会议员呼吁唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府考虑限制英伟达公司生产的人工智能芯片的出口，称中国人工智能公司 DeepSeek 依赖这些芯片。【原文：Two U.S. Congress members are calling on President Donald Trump's administration to consider restricting the export of artificial intelligence chips made by Nvidia, alleging Chinese AI firm DeepSeek has relied on them.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，星巴克与工会同意引入调解员进行合同谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，星巴克及其代表 10,000 多名咖啡师的工会已同意引入一名外部调解员，以帮助恢复中断的谈判。【原文：Starbucks and its union representing more than 10,000 baristas have agreed to bring in an outside mediator to help resume halted bargaining talks, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：OpenAI 正在洽谈一轮投资，估值高达 3400 亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，OpenAI 正在洽谈一轮投资，该轮投资将使这家人工智能初创公司的估值高达 3400 亿美元。【原文：OpenAI is in talks for an investment round that would value the AI startup at up to $340 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 意大利隐私监管机构封杀中国人工智能应用 DeepSeek
item.description: 意大利数据保护机构周四表示，由于缺乏关于中国人工智能模型 DeepSeek 使用个人数据的信息，该机构已经封杀了 DeepSeek。【原文：Italy's data protection authority said on Thursday it had blocked Chinese artificial intelligence model DeepSeek over a lack of information on its use of personal data.】

item.title: 消息人士透露，Blackstone 正在洽谈购买纽约办公楼的股份
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的消息人士周四透露，Blackstone 正在与摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）的机构投资者洽谈购买纽约一栋 50 层办公楼的大量股份。【原文：Blackstone is in talks to buy a sizeable stake in a New York 50-story office building from institutional investors of JPMorgan Asset Management, two sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 尽管 DeepSeek 动荡不安，Blackstone 仍坚持数据中心投资
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone）周四表示，其在数据中心的大规模投资不会因中国 DeepSeek 的低成本人工智能模型而受到影响，因为对实体基础设施的需求对人工智能仍然至关重要。【原文：Blackstone said on Thursday its massive investments in data centers would not be undermined by the low-cost artificial intelligence models from China's DeepSeek, as the need for physical infrastructure was still vital for AI.】

item.title: 首席执行官称，瑞银资本要求的提高将增加其他银行的成本
item.description: 瑞士银行首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）周四表示，作为一家系统性相关银行，对瑞银施加更高的资本要求将使企业和家庭承担更高的成本。【原文：Imposing higher capital requirements on UBS as a systemically relevant bank will usher in higher costs for companies and households, the Swiss lender's CEO, Sergio Ermotti, said on Thursday.】

item.title: Netspend 在纽约和解协议中赔偿多收的客户费用
item.description: 可充值借记卡和工资卡供应商 Netspend 将支付约 110 万美元，以了结纽约州对其非法向低收入客户收取高额预支工资利息并让讨债公司扣押其资金的指控。【原文：Netspend, a provider of reloadable debit cards and payroll cards, will pay about $1.1 million to settle New York state accusations it illegally charged low-income customers exorbitant interest rates on paycheck advances, and let debt collectors seize their funds.】

item.title: 首席执行官表示，H&M 必须提高标准以应对激烈的快速时尚竞争
item.description: H&M 公司首席执行官丹尼尔-埃尔弗（Daniel Erver）告诉路透社记者，H&M 公司不能仅靠价格取胜，必须在竞争激烈的快速时尚行业中使自己的服装更时尚、质量更高。【原文：H&M cannot win on price alone and must make its clothes more trendy and of higher-quality in the fiercely competitive fast-fashion sector, its CEO Daniel Erver told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国司法部起诉阻止惠普企业 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络
item.description: 美国司法部周四向加利福尼亚州一家联邦法院提起诉讼，要求阻止惠普公司以 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）的交易。【原文：The Department of Justice has sued to block Hewlett Packard Enterprise's $14 billion deal to acquire Juniper Networks , according to a complaint filed on Thursday in a federal court in California.】

item.title: 语音人工智能初创公司 ElevenLabs 完成新一轮融资，估值达 33 亿美元
item.description: ElevenLabs 周四表示，它在新一轮融资中筹集了 1.8 亿美元，使这家语音克隆人工智能初创公司的估值翻了三倍，达到 33 亿美元。【原文：ElevenLabs said on Thursday it has raised $180 million in a new funding round that triples the voice cloning artificial intelligence startup's valuation to $3.3 billion.】

item.title: 开云集团向美国投资者西蒙出售意大利奢侈品分店
item.description: 法国奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）周四宣布，已将旗下意大利 The Mall Luxury Outlets 的 100%股权出售给美国房地产投资商西蒙公司（Simon），净收益约为 3.5 亿欧元，这也是开云集团重组其房地产投资组合计划的一部分。【原文：French luxury group Kering announced on Thursday it had sold 100% of its Italian The Mall Luxury Outlets to U.S. real estate investor Simon, generating some 350 million euros in net proceeds as part of a wider plan to restructure its real estate portfolio.】

item.title: 消息人士称，收购公司 NGP 寻求以 20 亿美元出售天然气生产商 Camino
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士周四透露，私募股权公司 NGP Energy Capital Management 正在探索出售天然气生产商卡米诺自然资源公司（Camino Natural Resources），包括债务在内的估值可能达到 20 亿美元左右。【原文：Private equity firm NGP Energy Capital Management is exploring a sale of natural gas producer Camino Natural Resources, which may achieve a valuation of around $2 billion including debt, sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 备忘录称，高盛集团的瑞安-诺兰将在 13 年后离开该行
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）技术、媒体和电信部门合伙人兼软件投资银行业务全球联席主管 Ryan Nolan 即将离开该行。【原文：Goldman Sachs' Ryan Nolan, a partner in the technology, media and telecommunications group and global co-head of software investment banking, is leaving the bank, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 沃尔玛加拿大公司将投资 40 多亿美元扩建门店和供应链
item.description: 沃尔玛加拿大公司周四表示，将投资约 65 亿加元（45.1 亿美元）建设新店并扩大供应链，这是该公司自近 30 年前开设第一家门店以来的最大一笔投资。【原文：Walmart Canada said on Thursday it is investing about C$6.5 billion ($4.51 billion) to build new stores and expand its supply chain, marking its biggest ever investment since opening its first store nearly 30 years ago.】

item.title: 华丽七重奏 "收益落地，股市上涨；黄金接近历史纪录
item.description: 华尔街股市周四反弹，原因是投资者对美达公司（Meta）的财报欢欣鼓舞，但对微软公司（Microsoft）的财报避之不及，同时美元汇率下跌，进一步提振了金价。【原文：Wall Street shares rallied on Thursday, as investors cheered earnings from Meta , but shunned Microsoft , while the dollar dipped, further boosting gold prices.】

item.title: 富国银行投资银行业务联席首席执行官乔恩-韦斯将卸任
item.description: 富国银行企业与投资银行部（CIB）联席首席执行官乔恩-韦斯（Jon Weiss）周四表示，他已通知银行有意退休，并将从即日起卸任。【原文：Wells Fargo's co-CEO of corporate and investment banking (CIB), Jon Weiss, has informed the bank of his intention to retire and will step down from his position effective immediately, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，ITV与红鸟国际传媒集团（RedBird IMI）就合并制片业务举行早期谈判
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，英国广播公司 ITV 已与阿布扎比支持的集团 RedBird IMI 就合并各自制作业务的可能性进行了早期谈判。【原文：British broadcaster ITV has been holding early stage talks with Abu Dhabi-backed group RedBird IMI about a possible merger of their respective production businesses, two people with knowledge of the situation said.】

item.title: 美国成屋待完成销售下降，中断四个月涨势
item.description: 由于较高的抵押贷款利率削弱了人们的承受能力，价格较高的东北部和西部地区的购房合同下降尤为明显。【原文：Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes fell in December to snap a four-month streak of increases, with particularly sharp declines in the pricier Northeast and West regions as higher mortgage interest rates dented affordability.】

item.title: 大陆集团康迪泰克事业部将关闭在德国的四家工厂
item.description: 德国汽车零部件供应商大陆集团（ContiTech）旗下的康迪泰克公司（ContiTech）周四表示，将全面关闭四家工厂，并对另外两家工厂进行人事调整，受影响员工总数将达到 580 人。【原文：German car parts supplier Continental's ContiTech division is to fully close down four plants and make personnel changes at two other sites, affecting a total of 580 employees, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国证交会审理艾伦-斯坦福巨额欺诈案结案，法官下令罚款
item.description: 一名联邦法官下令结束美国证券交易委员会对艾伦-斯坦福 72 亿美元庞氏骗局长达 16 年之久的诉讼，指示这位金融家和两位前同事支付大部分将无法收回的款项。【原文：A federal judge ordered an end to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's 16-year-old lawsuit over Allen Stanford's $7.2 billion Ponzi scheme, directing the financier and two former colleagues to pay sums that will go largely uncollected.】

item.title: 大型央行从 2025 年开始走向不同方向
item.description: 2025 年的首次央行会议表明，随着美国维持利率稳定、欧元区下调利率、日本坚定地开启加息模式，今年将是政策制定者各行其是、经济走势分化的一年。【原文：The first central bank meetings of 2025 suggest it will be a year in which policymakers go their own way as economic paths diverge, as the United States holds interest rates steady, the euro zone cuts, and outlier Japan is firmly in hiking mode.】

item.title: ASML 将停止公布最受关注的指标 - 预订额
item.description: 顶级计算机芯片设备制造商阿斯麦公司（ASML）决定停止公布其季度财报中最受关注的数据--新订单预订量，称这一数据过于 "多变"，导致其股价波动过大。【原文：Top computer chip equipment maker ASML has decided to stop publishing the most closely-watched figure in its quarterly financial results, new order bookings, saying it is too "lumpy" and leads to excessive volatility in its share price.】

item.title: 自主技术初创公司 Avride 与 Grubhub 合作推出送餐机器人
item.description: 自主技术初创公司 Avride 周四表示，它已与食品配送公司 Grubhub 合作，在全美大学校园部署其机器人。【原文：Autonomous technology startup Avride said on Thursday it has partnered with food delivery company Grubhub to deploy its robots on college campuses across the United States.】

item.title: 企业争先恐后地在潜在关税前将货物运往美国
item.description: 最近几个月，许多企业高管都表示，他们对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普广泛的关税威胁采取观望态度。早前发布的假日季度财报显示，许多企业高管并未采取观望态度。【原文：In recent months, plenty of business executives have said they were taking a wait-and-see approach to U.S. President Donald Trump's broad threats of tariffs. Early holiday-quarter earnings reports show many of them were not.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数降幅超过预期
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数降幅超过预期，这表明尽管失业者的工作机会越来越少，但裁员率却很低。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, pointing to low layoffs though job opportunities are becoming scarce for those who are out of work.】
